info.title: OneTrust
info.description: OneTrust is a trust intelligence platform that helps organizations manage privacy, security, and governance. This connector provides access to OneTrust Risk Management and Incident Management APIs.

post.description: Model Context Protocol endpoint for Copilot Studio integration with OneTrust Risk and Incident Management.
Create a new risk in the Risk Register. The response will include the unique identifier of the created risk.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the created risk.

post.description: Create a new incident in the Incident Register. The response will return the unique identifier of the newly created incident.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the created incident.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific incident by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident.

dateOccurred.description: Date and time when the incident occurred.

dateDiscovered.description: Date and time when the incident was discovered.

createdDateTime.description: Date and time when the incident was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: Date and time when the incident was last updated.

put.description: Update an existing incident in the Incident Register.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident to update.

post.description: Search for incidents using filters and full-text search. Returns a paginated list of incidents matching the criteria.
Move an incident to the next workflow stage.
Link an incident to one or more inventory items such as assets, processing activities, vendors, or entities.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident.

parameters.name: inventoryType
parameters.description: The type of inventory to link.

get.description: Retrieve the hierarchical list of organizations configured in OneTrust. Use this to obtain organization group IDs required for creating risks and incidents.

put.description: Create or update a risk based on matching attributes. If a risk with matching attributes exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new risk will be created.

parameters.name: matchAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names to match on (e.g., 'name,orgGroupId').

riskId.description: The unique identifier of the created or updated risk.

put.description: Update all fields of an existing risk in the Risk Register.

parameters.name: riskId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the risk to update.

delete.description: Delete a risk from the Risk Register by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: riskId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the risk to delete.

patch.description: Partially update specific fields of an existing risk. Only the provided fields will be modified.

parameters.name: riskId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the risk to modify.

post.description: Move a risk to a different workflow stage.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the risk.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific risk template by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: riskTemplateId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the risk template.

riskType.description: Type of risk this template is for.

createdDateTime.description: Date and time when the template was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: Date and time when the template was last updated.

deadline.description: Deadline for the risk, format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.FFFZ.

reminderDays.description: Number of days before the deadline when a reminder will be sent.

controlIds.description: Set of control identifiers to associate with the risk.

riskTemplate.description: Risk template to use for the risk.

name.description: Name of the incident. Provide a descriptive name so it can be quickly referenced in the incident register.

incidentTypeName.description: The name of the type of incident that has occurred.

orgGroupId.description: The organization identifier. Retrieve from the Get List of Organizations API.

dateOccurred.description: The date and time when the incident occurred (ISO 8601 UTC).

dateDiscovered.description: The date and time when the incident was discovered (ISO 8601 UTC).

deadline.description: The date by which the incident investigation or notification must be completed (ISO 8601 UTC).

rootCause.description: The root cause summary of the incident.

notificationNeeded.description: Indicates whether a notification is required for this incident.

autoAssessJurisdictions.description: If true, automatically assess jurisdictions after incident creation.

fullText.description: Full-text search string to match against incident fields.

filters.description: Array of filter criteria to narrow search results.

fieldName.description: Name of the field to filter on.

associatedInventory.description: Associated inventory item for the risk.

inventoryType.description: Type of inventory (e.g., ASSET, PROCESSING_ACTIVITY, VENDOR, ENTITY).

inventoryId.description: Identifier of the associated inventory item.

reminderDays.description: Number of days before the deadline to send a reminder.

controlIds.description: Set of control identifiers to associate with the risk.

riskTemplate.description: Risk template to use for the risk.

reminderDays.description: Number of days before the deadline to send a reminder.

nextStageId.description: The identifier of the next workflow stage.

parameters.description: Additional parameters for the stage transition.

nextStageName.description: The name of the next workflow stage to transition to.

parameters.description: Additional parameters for the stage transition.

inventoryIds.description: List of inventory item identifiers to link.

externalIds.description: List of external identifiers for the inventory items.

sourceType.description: Source type for the inventory link.

assigneeEmail.description: Email of the incident assignee. Valid only when the assignee type is USER.

type.description: Indicates whether the assignee is an individual user or a group.

countryCode.description: Three-digit country code of the jurisdiction.

stateProvinceCode.description: State/province code. Required if country code is USA or CAN.
